entries: This item has 2 charges, and regains all expended charges at dusk. As an action, you can cast a random spell from the mask at a range of 60 feet (regardless of the spell description). Choose a target and roll on the following table to determine the effect.

entries.name: Protection of the Swamp
entries: While attuned to this item, you are unaffected by the following spells: {@spell witch bolt}, {@spell hex}, {@spell polymorph}, and {@spell hypnotic pattern} (even those cast by you). Additionally, you gain resistance to poison damage and are immune to all diseases.

item.name: Port-a-boulder
entries: This 1-inch cube appears to be made from solid stone but weighs next to nothing. It has an eerie blue glow to it.

entries.name: Explosive Expansion
entries: When the stone touches any type of earthen surface of at least 5 feet by 5 feet, it rapidly expands to a 10-foot cube of solid rock. Any creatures occupying a space that the cube expands into are pushed outward and take {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage. The expanded boulder weighs 1500 lbs and does not glow.

The rock instantly returns to its original size when it is no longer in contact with an earthen surface (for example, if it is pushed off a ledge). Alternatively, it can be returned to its original size by speaking a command word which will make it shrink over the course of 1 minute.

item.name: Ruby Evertorch
entries: A deep crimson flame sprouts from the basket of this metal-weave torch.

entries.name: Flamebringer
entries: As a bonus action you can speak a command word to cause this torch to light itself, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. If you make a melee attack with the flame active, it deals an additional 1 point of fire damage.

item.name: Song
entries: This beautiful and deadly {@item rapier|phb} features three rubies embedded in its basket and vibrates when it is swung, creating a delicate chime sound as it passes through the air.
你用这个魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷有+1的加成。它有以下附加属性。

entries.name: Charming
entries: Once every three days, you can use this rapier to cast {@spell charm person}.

entries.name: Song and Dance
entries: When you make successful attacks with both Song and {@item Dance|RotR1} in the same round, you deal an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage with the weapon you attacked with last.

entries.name: Two of a Kind
entries: Attunement to both Song and {@item Dance|RotR1} counts as a single attunement.

item.name: Stalker's Dart
entries: This flanged {@item dart|phb} has a small golden beryl gemstone embedded into the rear. Its wide metal fins hum as the dart flies through the air.
你用这个魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷有+1的加成。它有以下附加属性。

entries.name: Mark of the Hunted
entries: Upon a succesfull attack, the gemstone in this dart shatters and releases an arcane mark. For the next 6 hours, if the creature is within 1000 feet of you, you sense its direction relative to you. If the creature is in motion you know the direction of its movement. This effect can be dispelled.

entries.name: Single Use
entries: Activating the arcane mark shatters the gem, removing the enchantment and causing it to become a mundane dart.

item.name: Talisman of the Satyr
entries: This amulet, shaped like the skull of a {@creature satyr|mm}, features a large opalite gemstone embedded in the forehead.

entries.name: Master of the Bow
entries: When you make a ranged attack with a {@item shortbow|phb}, {@item longbow|phb}, or any type of crossbow and a hostile creature within 5 feet of you, you do not suffer disadvantage on the ranged attack roll. Additionally, the normal and long ranges of these weapons are each 10 feet longer while you are attuned to this item.

entries.name: Sounds of the Forest
entries: While attuned to this item, you are proficient with {@item pan flute|phb|pan flutes} if you aren't already. With a successful Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check ({@dc 15}) when playing a pan flute, you can attract {@dice 1d8} birds from your surroundings, if there are any. Most types of songbirds will happily tweet along to your music.

item.name: The Northern Winds
item.reqAttune: by a druid, monk, ranger, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: A delicate elven face adorns the head of this metal staff, a large blue diamond embedded in the back of its head. The staff feels cool to the touch, even when in warm environments.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While holding it, you also gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls that deal frost damage.

entries.name: Arctic Storm
entries: As an action, you can summon a swirling storm of glittering ice encompassing a 20-foot tall, 50-foot radius cylinder centered on a point you can see within 120 feet. When a creature enters or ends its turn inside the storm, it must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 18}) or take {@damage 3d6} frost damage, or half that on a success. The effect lasts for 1 minute and requires concentration. This feature may be used once per day.

entries.name: Go with the Wind
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell wind walk} once every 3 days, eschewing material components.

entries.name: Icy Touch
entries: When holding this staff in at least one hand, you have resistance to frost damage.

item.name: Thorn of the North
entries: The arms of this {@item longbow|phb} are covered in sharp thorns.
你用这个魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷有+1的加成。它有以下附加属性。

entries.name: Barbed Shot
entries: This bow holds 6 charges. Each day at dawn it regains {@dice 1d6} charges. Before making an attack with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to add sharp thorns to the arrow you are shooting. If your attack is successful, add {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Might of the Rose
entries: Alternatively, you can expend charges to cast spells from the table below. Any spell save DC is 15.

item.name: Totem of Tongues
entries: {@i This item is only usable by a {@class druid} or {@class warlock}.}
This small totem is adorned with three tribal faces, each with their tongue out.

entries.name: Sharp Tongue
entries: As a ritual, you can cast the spell {@spell tongues} using this totem in place of the material component. You can use this feature twice every three days.

item.name: Tunic of the Warmage's Apprentice
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster
entries: This otherwise unremarkable {@item leather armor|phb} features a glowing, shield-shaped gem affixed to the chest.

entries.name: Spell-Infused
entries: This armor is infused with the {@spell mage armor} spell. The enchantment can be dispelled, at which point it reverts to mundane leather armor (AC 11 + Dex). If dispelled, the enchantment will automatically be restored after 24 hours.

entries.name: Apprentice of the Arcane
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a +1 bonus to all spell attacks. Additionally, if you cast an evocation spell that deals damage, it deals +2 bonus damage of the original type.

item.name: Twin Hook Swords
entries: Often made from a single piece of metal with cloth wraps for handles, these paired {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} feature a very unusual hook at the end, along with an extra blade serving as a knuckle guard.

entries.name: Sweep the Leg
entries: When you hit with one of these swords, you can use a bonus action to attempt to {@action shove} a creature {@condition prone} by hooking one of its legs. On a successful shove, you deal an extra {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and pull the creaure prone. This feature only works on bipedal creatures or winged flying creatures.

entries.name: Climber's Hook
entries: You can use these swords to anchor yourself while climbing, similar to a {@item climber's kit|phb}. When you do, you gain advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made for climbing.

item.name: Twin Serpent Staff
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This wooden {@item quarterstaff|phb} features two large serpent's heads on either end that seem to move slightly when viewed out of the corner of one's eye.

entries.name: Acid Spray
entries: As an action, you can cast {@spell Melf's acid arrow} at 3rd level. This feature may be used once per day.

entries.name: Life Transfer
entries: As an action, you can cause the two snake heads to bite down on two different willing creatures. The creature with the lowest number of missing hit points takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage. The other creature heals an equivalent number of hit points + 4. Any poisons  affecting the first creature are transferred to the second. This feature may be used once per long rest.

item.name: Violin of the Afterlife
item.reqAttune: by a bard with proficiency with viols
entries: This finely-crafted wooden {@item viol|phb} bears the appearance of a skull on the body, with carved teeth acting as the bridge.

entries.name: Dirge of the Dead
entries: When you make a spell attack against an undead creature using this instrument as your spellcasting focus, the attack is made with advantage.

entries.name: Shriek of the Afterlife
entries: As an action, you can play a succession of notes on this instrument that will cause a black mist to erupt from the F-holes. The mist coalesces into the form of a face, and shrieks with a terrifying scream.

Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 15}) or become {@condition frightened} of you. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the beginning of its turn if it cannot see you. You can use this feature once every three days.

item.name: Wand of Catnap
entries: This simple wooden wand has a small iron cat sleeping along the shaft at one end.

entries.name: Power Nap
entries: You can use this wand to cast {@spell catnap|xge} at 5th level. You can use this feature once every three days.

item.name: Waterwalkers
entries: These soft, comfortable leather boots feature a blue silk stripe along the laces and teardrop-shaped turquoise gems embedded into the tongues.

entries.name: Liquid to Solid
entries: Twice per day, you can use a bonus action to click the heels of these boots together to enable you to walk on any surface of water as if it were solid ground (per the spell {@spell water walk}, but only on water). You may use a bonus action to click the heels again to deactivate the boots.

entries.name: Aquatic Booster
entries: These boots give you a swim speed of 20 feet, or a 10-foot bonus to your swim speed if you already have one.

item.name: Wavecaller
entries: This silvered horn has the image of waves etched around its bell.

entries.name: Song of the Sea
entries: When sounding this horn at sea (or any other body of salt water), a gentle wave pushes your vessel forward, increasing the maximum speed of the vessel by 1 mile per hour for 12 hours.

entries.name: Fog of War
entries: Once per day, you can use an action to sound the horn and cast {@spell fog cloud}, creating a 60-foot cloud rather than a 20-foot cloud.

item.name: Willow's Whisper
item.reqAttune: by a bard with proficiency with flutes
entries: This finely-crafted wooden {@item flute|phb} features green vines curling around its shaft.

entries.name: Melody of the Willow's Bark
entries: As an action, you can play a soft tune on this flute laced with the healing essence of the willow's bark. Anyone within a 30-foot radius that can hear you play receives {@dice 1d8 + 2} points of healing. This song also cures most mundane diseases and relieves pain.

entries.name: Way of the Willows
entries: Once per day, you can use this flute to cast {@spell tree stride}.

item.name: Ardent Enforcer
entries: The head of this heavy iron {@item warhammer|phb} glows red-hot.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Infernal Metal
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4 + 1} fire damage on each hit.

entries.name: Mark of the Fallen
entries: When you make a successful attack against a creature, you can use your bonus action to mark it with an infernal rune. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 15}) or become marked. While marked, the creature is vulnerable to fire and necrotic damage for 1 minute. If the creature was immune to these types of damage, they become resistant instead. If the creature was resistant, they are no longer resistant. You may use this feature twice per long rest.

item.name: Arm of the Fire Genasi Veteran
entries: This prosthetic arm flows faintly with a red aura. Runes are inscribed along each joint, keeping the arm together.

entries.name: Renewed Strength
entries: While attuned to this prosthetic your Strength score increases by 2 and can exceed 20, but not 30. Additionally, any unarmed strikes you make with this arm recieve a +2 bonus to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Fireproof
entries: You are immune to fire damage whenever you touch or hold something with this arm that would otherwise deal fire or cold damage.

entries.name: Blistering Grip
entries: Once per day you can cast {@spell heat metal} on the hand of this arm. This requires no concentration and does not deal any damage to you.

entries.name: Prosthetic Bond
entries: To attune to this arm, you must hold the base against the amputated end of one of your arms (amputated at the elbow or upper arm) for the duration of a short rest. The arm will not function or attune if your arms are whole.

item.name: Bifocals of the Basilisk
entries: These jade-lensed goggles are difficult to see through from the outside, but when worn provide the wearer with clear vision.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: These goggles grant you {@sense darkvision} up to 90 feet. In darkness, instead of seeing in shades of gray you see in shades of green.

entries.name: Stone Cold
entries: While wearing these goggles you are immune to the petrifying effects of creatures such as {@creature basilisk|mm|basilisks} or {@creature medusa|mm|medusas} that take hold through eye contact.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: As an action you can gaze at one creature you can see (and that can see you) and cast {@spell flesh to stone} eschewing all components ({@dc 12}). You can use this feature once every three days.

item.name: Black Market Exchange Chest
entries: This otherwise unremarkable chest has a thick blue ribbon encircling it, with a heavy metal clasp holding it in place.

entries.name: Unknown Buyer
entries: After placing items in this chest, before you close the lid you may speak a command word and state an amount of gold that you expect in return. If you close the box without stating an amount it is considered to be 0. The lid slams down and the clasped ribbon magically seals it for 24 hours. If the contents have been purchased you will find the exact amount of gold that you requested upon opening. If the price has not been paid you find your items inside, untouched. You do not know who buys these items or why.

entries.name: Pocket Dimension
entries: The opening of this chest is 2 feet by 3 feet, and the chest stands roughly 2 feet high. However, the interior of the chest expands to fit objects placed inside, up to a 10-foot cube. The chest cannot close if any living creature is inside. All spells cast inside the chest have no effect.

Placing a black market exchange chest inside an extradimensional space created by a {@item Heward's handy haversack}, {@item portable hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

item.name: Chop
entries: This simple {@item handaxe|phb} has faint runes etched into the poll.

entries.name: Fine Steel
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Lumberjack's Best Friend
entries: This weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing damage to plant creatures and objects or items made from wood.

item.name: Circlet of the Phoenix
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This fine rose gold circlet is warm to the touch, gentle heat radiating from the fire topaz embedded in its crest.

entries.name: Heart of the Fire Plane
entries: While attuned to this circlet, you are resistant to fire damage and gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls that deal fire damage. Spells you cast requiring a saving throw gain +2 to their save DC if the spell deals fire damage.

entries.name: Feather of the Phoenix
entries: You can cast {@spell feather fall} at will, using this circlet as a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: From the Ashes (Hidden Feature)
entries: When a creature attuned to this item dies, their body erupts in a burst of flames. Creatures in a 10-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 15}) or receive 2d10 Fire damage, or half on a success. The creature that was wearing the circlet and all the non-magical equipment they were carrying crumble to ash. After {@dice 1d4} hours, they appear awake with full hit points on the elemental plane of fire, wearing only the {@item luminous vestments of the phoenix|RotR2}. This feature is not revealed by {@spell identify} or attuning to this item.

item.name: Curse Jar
entries: This clay jar features a grotesque, fanged mouth and two glowing emerald eyes. As you approach, you hear a voice in your mind hurling a stream of insults at you.

entries.name: Gold Eater
entries: Whenever you insult someone or utter a curse word, the jar speaks to you and commands you to put 1 gp into its mouth. The gold is instantly consumed by the jar and lost forever. The jar always knows how much gold it has been fed. You may resist doing so by succeeding on a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 10}).

entries.name: Foul-Mouthed
entries: Twice per day, you can pull the lid off the jar and use it cast a spell for a certain amount of gp that has been fed to it according to the table below. The jar does not require any spell components to cast a spell. When you cast a spell using this feature, the associated gold cost is deducted from the total amount. The spell save DC for spells cast using this feature is 15.
If there is not enough gold in the jar to cast the selected spell, the jar will scream insults at you for {@dice 1d4} rounds or until you feed it 1 gp in apology.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: A curse jar is a sentient chaotic neutral item with an Intelligence of 12, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 18. The jar communicates by transmitting words and emotions to the creature carrying or in posession of it, and it has hearing and normal vision out to a range of 60 feet. It can understand and speak every language its owner can. Its voice is tinny and raspy, and it cackles with delight whenever it is fed.

The jar craves strife, and while it is not evil {@i per se}, it is greedy and vindictive. It is under no obligation to be truthful about how much gold it has consumed, and if it doesn't like its owner, it may attempt to trick them into feeding it more gold. If the owner of a curse jar does not feed it at least 1 gp every day, the most expensive spell available is cast on the owner per its {@i Foul-Mouthed} ability.

item.name: Delilah
entries: This simple {@item light crossbow|phb} feels lighter than it should be.

entries.name: My Dearest Delilah
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Heartseeker
entries: As part of your attack, you may whisper a command word to imbue the next bolt you fire with magic. Your next attack with this crossbow is made with advantage, and the bolt is capable of ignoring all cover. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dragon Satchel
entries: This leather shoulder bag is emblazoned with a golden dragon's head.

entries.name: Essence of the Elements
entries: You can place up to two handfuls of one of the materials listed below in this satchel. Over the course of the next 24 hours, the material turns into a fine crystalline powder. As an action, you can throw one handful of powder. The powder erupts in a 10-foot cone of the element listed below. Creatures within the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 15}) or take {@damage 3d4} damage. They take half damage on a successful save. Doing this twice empties the satchel, after which you can fill it with new material.

item.name: Duality Blade
entries: Like a shadow in your hand, this {@item shortsword|phb} feels almost unreal. A long hole is driven along the center of the blade.

entries.name: Streamers of Light
entries: As a bonus action, you can speak a command word to shroud the blade in flowing streams of light. The sword sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light in a 30-foot radius while in this state. Additionally, attacks with this sword deal {@damage 1d4} necrotic + {@damage 1d4 + 2} radiant damage instead.

entries.name: Blade of Darkness
entries: The blade of this sword does not reflect any light and is difficult to discern in dim light and darkness. While you are in dim light or darkness, attacks with this weapon have a +3 bonus to hit and deal {@damage 1d4 + 2} necrotic + {@damage 1d4} radiant instead. Activating the {@i Streamers of Light} feature negates this effect.

item.name: Earring of Whispering
entries: This golden earring has a small chain clasp that fits onto the upper portion of the ear.

entries.name: Jenga
entries: As an action, this earring allows you to cast {@spell message} to another connected earring within 500 feet. The earring will always passively recieve messages. If the reciever is out of range they will hear nothing.

entries.name: Pairing
entries: Two or more earrings may be connected by holding them together for 10 minutes. If an earring is more than 5 miles away from another connected earring for at least 1 week, the connection will be broken and the earrings must be re-paired.

item.name: Frost Reaper
entries: This heavy iron scythe features a jagged icy blade.

entries.name: Cold-Hearted
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This weapon also deals an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage with each hit.

entries.name: Ice Harvest
entries: As an action, you can speak a command word to freeze {@dice 1d8} shards of ice from the moisture in the air around you. Choose any number of targets you can see within 60 feet (up to the number of shards formed) and roll a ranged weapon attack for each shard. Each hit deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} cold damage. You may use this feature twice per day.

item.name: Gapcloser 2000
entries: This gnomish invention features two crossbow bolt-like rods extending out from either side. Despite its complex operation, the Gapcloser 2000 is a feat of mundane engineering.

entries.name: Zipline
entries: As an action, you lift the Gapcloser 2000 into the air and activate its line launcher, which shoots both bolts in opposite directions, each attached to 50 feet of steel wire. Make a ranged weapon attack for each bolt. On two successful hits the wire tightens and you can use your movement to travel up to 50 feet between the two anchor points. You can cause the Gapcloser 2000 to detach and reel in the bolts as a bonus action. Refer to the table below for the ACs of various materials.

If one of the bolts strikes a creature, it deals {@damage 1d4 - 1} (minimum of 1) points of piercing damage and becomes lodged in their body. The creature can release itself by taking an action to make a Strength check ({@dc 10}).

item.name: Goodberry Sapling
entries: Most goodberries are created through magic such as {@spell goodberry}. In some rare cases, goodberries can be planted  to grow godberry bushes.

entries.name: Seed of the Feywild
entries: You can plant this sapling in any fertile ground. Over the course of {@dice 1d6} days a roughly 5-foot tall bush grows.

entries.name: Healthy Harvest
entries: Once the bush has grown, {@dice 1d4} berries grow on the bush every day to a maximum of 20 berries. These berries have the same properties as those conjured by {@spell goodberry}, and last for the same duration.
If all berries are plucked from the bush, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the bush will no longer grow any berries until it has been watered with water from the feywild.

item.name: L'Arcana #23
entries: This simple lipstick shimmers purple with an almost otherworldly appearance.

entries.name: Because Thou Art Worth It
entries: It takes about 30 seconds to apply L'Arcana #23, after which the effects last 8 hours or until it is removed. A full container of L'Arcana #23 comes with 15 uses; most found will have {@dice 1d6 - 1} uses missing.

While wearing this lipstick you gain a +1 bonus to every spell attack when casting a spell with a verbal component. In addition, your spell save DC for {@spell charm person} and {@spell charm monster|xge} increase by 2.

item.name: La Guillotina
entries: This massive {@item greataxe|phb} appears to be little more than a guillotine blade affixed to a reinforced handle.

entries.name: Repurposed Adamantine Blade
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Purge the Wicked
entries: Attacks made with this axe against good-aligned creatures are made at disadvantage and deal half damage on hit. It also cannot deal killing blows to good or neutral creatures.

entries.name: Voice of the Judge
entries: Twice per long rest, you can cast {@spell command} at 1st level ({@dc 14}).

item.name: Lash of the Hydra
entries: This wicked-looking {@item whip|phb} has a dark blade embedded in its tip. The handle seems too broad for just one cord...

entries.name: Essence of the Monster
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Hydra's Frenzy
entries: Whenever you attack a creature that is hostile toward you and roll a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}, an extra cord grows from the handle of the whip. Your attacks with this whip deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage for each extra cord. The whip can have a total of 5 cords. Extra cords disappear 12 hours after the last cord has grown, after which only 1 cord remains.

entries.name: Hydra's Curse
entries: Whenever you roll a natural 1 on an attack roll with this weapon, 1 cord disappears from the handle. However, if there is only 1 cord left, roll a {@dice d100}. On a 15 or lower the last cord disappears, making the whip useless and unable to grow any cords ever again. If you roll higher than 15 the last cord remains attached.

item.name: Luminous Vestments of the Phoenix
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: These brilliant robes radiate eternal heat, threatening to burn those around it.

entries.name: Soul of the Fire Plane
entries: While attuned to this robe you are immune to fire damage and have resistance to cold damage. You also gain a +4 bonus to your spell attack and your spell save DC increases by 2.

entries.name: Flight of the Phoenix
entries: Twice per long rest, you can use these robes to cast {@spell fly} at 6th level.

entries.name: Ashes to Ashes
entries: Once per long rest, you can use these robes to cast {@spell fire storm}.

item.name: Mantle of Vitalis
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, or druid
entries: These vestments seem to wave gently in the wind, even in still air.

entries.name: Legacy of the Healer
entries: This mantle has 3 charges that empower your healing spells. Whenever you cast a spell that heals hit points, you can spend 1 charge to heal one of the targets for an additional {@dice 3d8} + your spellcasting modifier. You can spend any number of charges at once, but each charge only affects one target and you cannot use multiple charges on the same target. All 3 charges are regained at dawn.

entries.name: Dreamwalker
entries: Once per long rest, you can use an action to cast {@spell dream}. Additionally, you are immune to all spells that would make you fall asleep while wearing this mantle (including your own).

item.name: Map Beacon
entries: These small metallic cubes light gently with different colors as you touch them.

entries.name: Binding the Beacon
entries: To bind to a beacon, a creature must hold one in their hand and speak a command word. Binding to the beacon does not count as attunement.

entries.name: Split the Party
entries: When a map beacon is placed onto a map and its command word is spoken, these tiny beacons will light up and hover over the location on the map of the creature they are bound to. If there are multiple bound creatures in one location, the beacons will hover over each other. If they are not anywhere on the map, the beacon lies still and dark.

Map beacons work best with detailed maps, but can also function to give general position on crudely-drawn maps. If you draw a map for this purpose, it must have at least three points of reference and be enclosed by a rectangular edge.

item.name: Mask of the Raven's Disciple
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, paladin, or warlock
entries: This metallic masquerade mask features a long, beak-like extension from the nose and a purple topaz embedded in the forehead.

entries.name: Wisdom from Beyond
entries: While attuned to this mask you recieve a +2 bonus to all Wisdom saving throws and Wisdom-based skill checks.

entries.name: My Queen
entries: The Strength score of a {@class cleric} or {@class paladin} attuned to this item increases by 1. The Charisma bonus of a {@class warlock} attuned to this item increases by 1. In you are multiclassed into both warlock and cleric or paladin, choose one bonus to apply when you attune.

entries.name: The Queen's Forgiveness
entries: Once per day, you can use this mask to cast {@spell spare the dying}, targeting a creature within 30 feet that you can see. When you do, the gemstone flares brightly for the duration of the casting. If you know the cantrip {@i spare the dying}, the gemstone shines dimly when you cast it normally.

item.name: Mountainguard's Greataxe
entries: This beautifully-crafted {@item greataxe|phb} features delicate etchings along the body of the blades.

entries.name: Dwarven-Forged
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Last Line of Defense
entries: As an action, you can slam the pommel of this axe on the ground to cause a ripple of gold energy to burst in a 30-foot radius. All creatures of your choice within this range become immune to being {@condition frightened} for the next minute. During this time, they also gain 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of their turns. You can use this feature once per day.

item.name: Nightliner
entries: What appears to be an ordinary inkwell is emblazoned with the image of an eye.

entries.name: Enchanted Eyes
entries: It takes 1 minute to apply this eyeliner to both eyes. While applied, you have {@sense darkvision} for a range of 60 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that depend on sight. These features last for 24 hours or until the makeup is removed. This eyeliner is not waterproof, and a full bottle contains enough eyeliner for 20 uses.

item.name: Orb of the Dryad
item.reqAttune: by a druid or monk
entries: This sparkling wooden orb hums gently when you listen closely.

entries.name: Nature's Light
entries: As an action, you can speak a command word to cause the orb to hover in front of you and shed light. This provides bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additinal 20 feet.

entries.name: Healing Flight
entries: Once per day, you can use an action to speak a command word and direct the orb to float in a straight line toward a creature within 100 feet. The orb moves at a speed of 50 feet per round on your turn. While in motion, the orb becomes ethereal and heals each creature it passes through for {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points. Upon arriving at the target, the orb hovers adjacent to them for 3 rounds, healing {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points at the beginning of your turn, then returns to you along the same line. The orb does not heal during its return to you.
While ethereal, the orb can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

item.name: Permafrost Axe
entries: This {@item handaxe|phb} appears to have a head made of permanently frozen ice, and is extremely cold to the touch.

entries.name: Freezing Edge
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This weapon also deals an additional 2 cold damage with each hit.

entries.name: Arctic Circle
entries: As a bonus action while holding this weapon, you can summon a small blizzard in a 15-foot radius around the axe that lasts for 30 seconds. This area is considered rough terrain. You do not need to hold this weapon for the entire duration of this feature, and the blizzard remains fixed centered on the axe. Each time a creature ends its turn in the blizzard, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 15}) or take {@damage 2d4} cold damage. You can use this feature twice per long rest.

item.name: Plate of the Sun and Stars
entries: This blackened suit of {@item plate armor|phb} has a faintly-glowing image of the sun surrounded by stars etched into the chest.

entries.name: Light of the Sun
entries: You can use this armor to cast {@spell sunbeam} at 6th level ({@dc 17}) once every 7 days.

entries.name: Blessing of the Stars
entries: This armor has 8 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8} spent charges at midnight. You can use a bonus action to spend 1 charge to bless a creature you can see within 50 feet. While blessed, the creature can choose to add {@dice 1d6} to a single attack roll they make within the next minute. You can spend up to 4 charges in one bonus action, but the effects of this feature do not stack.

entries.name: Heavenly Light
entries: Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 2 radiant damage as long as you have at least 1 charge remaining for {@i Blessing of the Stars} or have not used {@i Light of the Sun} within the last 7 days.

item.name: Pocket Portal
entries: The inside of this deliate glass orb contains a viscous purple fluid matching the ribbon wrapped around it.

entries.name: Homebrewed
entries: During the creation of this item, the liquid inside was brewed at the center of a permanent teleportation circle. As an action, you can smash the glass orb on the ground to cast {@spell teleportation circle}, creating a portal to the circle the liquid was brewed in.
Each pocket portal is good for only one use.

item.name: Repurposed Eyestalk
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This sturdy wand features a large preserved eye attached to the end. The eye follows your gaze disconcertingly.

entries.name: Intellect of the Beholder
entries: While attuned to this wand, your Intelligence score increases by 2 (to a maximum of 22). You also recieve a +1 bonus to all Wisdom {@skill Perception}) checks.

entries.name: Arcane Lens
entries: This wand holds 3 charges, which replenish each day at dawn. As an action you can point the wand at a target you can see within 120 feet and release a charge at random. Roll a {@dice 4} to determine the effect. All save DCs are your spell save DC or 16, whichever is higher. None of the ray effects requie concentration.

rows: {@b Fear Ray.} The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you per the {@spell cause fear|xge} spell.
{@b Necrotic Ray.} The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6 + 2} necrotic damage.
{@b Sleep Ray.} The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep per the {@spell sleep} spell.
{@b Ray of Mastery.} You cast a spell of your choice from your list of prepared spells that deals damage. This spell must be 3rd level or lower. You do not expend a spell slot to cast this spell.

item.name: Ring of the Fey
entries: This bone-white ring has a skull-like imprint on the face, and a sunstone gem adorning the top.

entries.name: Mind of the Fey
entries: While attuned to this ring your Intelligence score increases by 1. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to all Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) and Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) skill checks.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: While attuned to this ring you have advantage on all saving throws made to resist being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Light of the Feywild
entries: Onc per day you can use this ring to cast a special type of {@spell faerie fire}. {@i Faerie fire} cast in this manner does not require concentration and tints the affected area orange and red. While you are in the feywild the range and cube size increase by 10 feet.

item.name: Runechalk (Alabaster White)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: When drawn around a creature that is {@condition unconscious} and at 0 hit points, this will immediately stabilize them. This shape has no effect on constructs or the undead.
While standing inside the circle you are granted a {@dice 1d4} bonus on a single ability check of your choice.
Creates a sacred glypn that encompasses a 5-foot square. Any undead creature walking over the glyph must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 15}) or take {@damage 1d8 + 2} radiant damage.
Completely and irreversibly erases all information from a piece of paper or parchment.

item.name: Runechalk (Bright Yellow)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: Fills one container placed within the square with 1 pint of your favorite wine or ale.
Casts {@spell light} on the object the circle is drawn on.
Fills a container placed within the triangle with 1 pint of {@item oil (flask)|phb|oil}.
Wards a 5-foot square such that {@spell grease} ({@dc 12}) is cast on that space when a creature walks over it. A maximum of 3 bright yellow crosses may be active at a time.

item.name: Runechalk (Charming Pink)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: Tunes and repairs an instrument it is drawn on (per {@spell mending}).
While standing inside the circle, any music you play or vocalizations you make sound three times as loud.
Dramatic lighting fills a 10-foot cube centered around the triangle, causing Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made within the cube to gain a +3 bonus.
Causes a small display of {@spell prestidigitation}-based fireworks when stepped on by a creature.

item.name: Runechalk (Cloudy Gray)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: Anything drawn or written with this chalk and then enclosed within a square will appear in the sky per the {@spell skywrite|xge} spell. Using this feature takes two uses.
{@spell Fog cloud} is cast at 1st level, centered on the circle. Only one circle may be active at a time.
A translucent surface the triangle is drawn on becomes opaque for 1 hour.
Clouds begin to gather in the sky above the cross, threatening a thunderstorm.

item.name: Runechalk (Flame Red)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: The first creature that walks over this square must make a Dexterity saving thow ({@dc 10}) or take {@dice 1d6} fire damage. This shape only lasts for up to 24 hours.
A mundane campfire is conjured, with enough fuel to burn for 8 hours.
All food inside the triangle when it is completed is cooked to perfection.
Casts {@spell heat metal} ({@dc 12}) if drawn on a metal object.

item.name: Runechalk (Midnight Black)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: When drawn around a lock, the next Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check made to unlock it is made with advantage.
While standing inside the circle you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to spot traps.
{@item caltrop|phb|Caltrops} are conjured that cover a 5-foot square around the triangle.
When drawn on a piece of footwear, those wearing them gain a +3 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks for 1 hour. This effect does not stack.

item.name: Runechalk (Navy Blue)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: While standing inside the circle, you may cast {@spell shape water|xge} for the next hour. Only on creature may be under the influence of this shape at once.
Fills a container placed within the circle with up to 1 gallon of freshwater.
Creates an arcane umbrella 10 feet above this symbol shielding a 10-foot radius from rain.
Destroys up to 1 gallon of water inside a container placed on the cross.

item.name: Runechalk (Royal Purple)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: When drawn on a shield, grants a +1 bonus to AC for 1 hour. Only one shape may be active at a time.
When drawn on armor, grants resistance to bludgeoning damage for 1 hour. Only one shape may be active at a time.
When drawn on armor, grants resistance to piercing damage for 1 hour. Only one shape may be active at a time.
When drawn on armor, grants resistance to slashing damage for 1 hour. Only one shape may be active at a time.

item.name: Runechalk (Sky Blue)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: Casts {@spell alarm} on the edges of the square, up to a 20-foot cube.
Casts {@spell purify food and drink} on any container inside the circle.
Casts {@spell mending} on any object you draw it on.
Instantly locks a mechanical lock on a chest or door.

item.name: Runechalk (Swamp Green)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: A 5-foot square centered on this square becomes coated in a thick, gluelike substance. Any creature stepping through this space must make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check ({@dc 9}) to avoid becoming {@condition restrained}. If a creature becomes restrained, they may use an action to repeat the save. Only 1 square may be active at a time. The effects of this shape fade after 24 hours.
Coats a weapon or one piece of ammunition the shape is drawn on with acid, which deals an extra {@damage 1d4} acid damage on the next hit it makes.
Conjures one empty {@item vial|phb} within the triangle.
Grants acid resistance to the wearer of a shield or piece of armor the cross is drawn on.

item.name: Runechalk (Vine Green)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: When drawn around a plant, reveals basic information about the plant and any potential alchemical or magical uses.
Any alchemy- or herbology-based skill checks made within the triangle are made with advantage.
When drawn on an item or creature, reveals whether the target is poisonous or venemous to the person who drew the symbol.

item.name: Runechalk (Warm Orange)
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

entries.name: Chalk One Up
entries: As an action you can use this chalk to draw a simple symbol. A creature using this chalk must have an Intelligence of 10 or higher to draw these symbols. Only one symbol can be active at a time. You can draw up to 20 symbols with this chalk before it is used up.

rows: Transmutes up to 1 cubic foot of material into soft wood.
Transmutes up to 1 cubic foot of material to solid rock.
Transmutes up to 1 cubic foot of material to solid iron.
Transmutes up to 1 cubic foot of material to loose earth.

item.name: Sanctified Gilded Skull
entries: This gold-trimmed skull has three sapphire gems embedded into it: one in each eye, and one in the center of the forehead.

entries.name: Ward of the Afterlife
entries: If you are dealt necrotic damage while attuned to this item, roll {@dice 1d6} and subtract the rolled number from the amount of damage you receive. Additionally, undead creatures cannot be created or summoned within 100 feet of this item. (Existing undead can enter this range.)

entries.name: Necromantic Aversion
entries: If you are targeted with a necromanic spell of 1st through 3rd level, you may choose to negate the effects of the spell. If you choose to use this feature, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 5 or higher, the effect is negated. On a 1, the skull shatters and is destroyed. You may use this feature once per long rest.

item.name: Sapphire Claws
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, druid, fighter, or monk
entries: These dark bracers and gloves have sapphires embedded into the back of the hand, along the first row of knuckles, and as sharp nails projecting from the fingertips.

entries.name: Cat's Slash
entries: Your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance/immunity, and you are considered armed (dealing slashing damage instead of bludgeoning). You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Cave Climber
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to half your movement speed, and any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check made to grapple a creature has a +1 bonus.

entries.name: Crystal Shaper
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell mold earth|xge} and {@spell light}.

item.name: Sapphire Claws (Cursed)
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, druid, fighter, or monk
entries: These dark bracers and gloves have sapphires embedded into the back of the hand, along the first row of knuckles, and as sharp nails projecting from the fingertips.

entries.name: Cat's Slash
entries: Your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance/immunity, and you are considered armed (dealing slashing damage instead of bludgeoning). You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Cave Climber
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to half your movement speed, and any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check made to grapple a creature has a +1 bonus.

entries.name: Crystal Shaper
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell mold earth|xge} and {@spell light}.

entries.name: Sapphire Parasitism (Curse)
entries: This item is cursed, and attuning to it extends the curse to you. Until the curse is broken with {@spell remove curse} or similar magic (or by amputating the arm it is worn on), this item clasps painfully around your arms and is unable to be removed or unattuned. Despite this, you are unwilling to part with this item until the curse is broken.

If the curse is not broken in 1 week, you feel your fingertips turn cold and harden as they begin to fuse with the item over the course of {@dice 1d4} days. Once fused, nothing short of a {@spell wish} or amputating the arm it is worn on will break the curse.

item.name: Scout's Arrow
entries: This sleek arrow features runes etched into the tip.

entries.name: Farshot
entries: When you make a ranged attack with this arrow, the normal range for the bow is extended by 50 feet and the long range is extended by 100 feet.

entries.name: Sharp Eye
entries: On subsequent turns after shooting this arrow, you can spend an action to see the arrow's surroundings. This effect can last up to 1 minute and requires concentration. During this time, you are {@condition blinded||blind} and {@condition deafened||deaf} with respect to your own senses, seeing and hearing instead from the arrow.
While this effect is active, you have {@sense truesight} for a 60-foot radius centered on the arrow.

entries.name: Single Use
entries: Activating the {@i Sharp Eye} feature expends the magic enchanting it, causing it to become a mundane {@item arrow|phb}.

item.name: Shadowborn's Second Skin
entries: This otherwise unremarkable {@item leather armor|phb} features a small, crescent-shaped band of metal affixed to the chest.

entries.name: Shadow Stalker
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to all Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. While you are in dim light or darkness, this bonus rises to +4.

entries.name: Swift as Nightfall
entries: Once per day, you can use a bonus action to cast {@spell misty step}.

item.name: Shadowglass Dagger
entries: This {@item dagger|phb} was cut, rather than forged, from the purest of obsidian found in the Barrier Peaks.

entries.name: Unseen
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Shadow Recall
entries: Once per round as part of an attack, you can cause this blade to reappear in your hand from up to 200 feet away. It disappears into a void of darkness and appears in a free hand. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to recall the blade.

entries.name: Twist the Knife
entries: Twice per day following a successful attack with this weapon, you can let go of it (if the attack was a melee attack) and use a bonus action to speak a command word. Doing so causes the blade to twist in the wound, dealing an additional {@dice 2d4 + 2} damage.

entries.name: Slippery Surface
entries: This dagger cannot be coated in any type of poison, nor can it suffer any metal-based decay such as rust.

item.name: Shield of the Roc
entries: This feather-shaped shield feels lighter than it should be for its size.

entries.name: Light as a Feather
entries: Twice per long rest, you can use your reaction to cast {@spell feather fall} on yourself.

entries.name: Elemental Origin
entries: Once per day, if you are on the elemental plane of air with this shield, you can spend an action to gain a flying speed equal to your normal movement speed for 1 hour. If this shield has been present on the elemental plane of air for 24 consecutive hours, this feature can be used on any plane, and its rarity increases to rare. (See {@item Shield of the Roc (Rare)|RotR2}.)

item.name: Shield of the Roc (Rare)
entries: This feather-shaped shield feels lighter than it should be for its size.

entries.name: Light as a Feather
entries: Twice per long rest, you can use your reaction to cast {@spell feather fall} on yourself.

entries.name: Elemental Origin
entries: Once per day, you can spend an action to gain a flying speed equal to your normal movement speed for 1 hour.

item.name: Staff of Amplification
entries: This metallic staff features a curious holed box at the top.

entries.name: Arcane Voice
entries: Whenever you cast a spell with a verbal component that requires the target to make a saving throw, your spell save DC has a +2 bonus.

entries.name: Reverberating Performance
entries: If you are capable of granting {@classFeature bardic inspiration|bard||1||bardic inspiration}, you may grant any creature that uses your bardic inspiration die (including yourself) a bonus to the inspiration die roll equal to your Charisma modifier. You may declare granting this bonus before the inspiration die is rolled. You may use this feature twice per long rest.

entries.name: Stage Presence
entries: You can cause your voice to boom up to three times as loud as normal for up to 1 minute per the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip.

item.name: Tiny Duck Crown
entries: This bracelet appears to have a duck's foot imprinted on one side.

entries.name: Karl's Legacy
entries: While attuned to this bracelet, you gain a +1 bonus to your Wisdom score.

Each day at dawn, roll a {@dice d20}. If the result is 10 or higher, all ducks in a 1-mile radius flock to you over the next hour and follow you around until dusk. Roll on the table below to determine how many ducks follow you.

entries.name: King of Ducks
entries: By speaking a command word ("Quack"), up to 5 ducks will perform the {@action help} action (minimum of 3 ducks). The ducks cannot attack, and will not perform any other action. Each duck has 1 hit point and an AC of 5. The ducks that assist you leave once the task has been completed. This feature cannot be used if there are fewer than 3 ducks remaining, but the remaining ducks will still follow you until dusk.

item.name: Warmage's Longsword
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster
entries: The blade and pommel of this {@item longsword|phb} feature several shimmering jaspers.

entries.name: Battleworn
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Knowledge of the Warmage
entries: While attuned to this sword you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) and Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks.

entries.name: Arcane Barrage
entries: This sword has 5 charges, one in each gemstone on the blade. As an action you may expend charges to release {@spell magic missile} darts. You may expend any number of charges at once, releasing 1 dart for every charge spent. All spent charges are regained at dawn.

item.name: Wayfinder
entries: Faint arcane runes run along the length of this {@item longsword|phb}, which seems to drift in a certain direction when not being attended to.

entries.name: Etched and Honed
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行攻击和伤害的时候有一个+1的奖励。

entries.name: Wanderer of the Wilds
entries: While attuned to this sword you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks.

entries.name: Compass
entries: While on the material plane, you can place this sword on the ground and speak a command word, causing the sword to slowly rotate until the point faces northward. If you are not on the material plane, the sword will point toward the nearest portal back to the material plane (if there is one).

item.name: Wrath of the Tempest
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: This simple silver ring features a deep blue gemstone swirling with stormclouds within.

entries.name: Stormcloud
entries: Once per day, you can use an action to cast {@spell call lightning} at 4th level.

entries.name: At Home in the Storm
entries: While attuned to this ring, you recieve a +1 bonus to your Constitution score. You gain an additional bonus to your Charisma, Intelligence, or Charisma skill if you are one of the following subclasses:

rows: {@class cleric||Tempest Domain cleric|Tempest}, {@class druid||Circle of the Land druid|Land}

entries: If you are multiclassed into two or more of the above subclasses, the bonus applies to the class you have more levels in. If these levels are the same, choose one of the ability scores to recieve the bonus when you attune.

item.name: Amulet of the Huntress
entries: This brass amulet bears a striking resemblance to a wildcat's face.

entries.name: Predator's Stealth
entries: While attuned to this amulet, you gain a +3 bonus to all Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Weapons of Choice
entries: When dealing slashing or piercing damage, you gain +1 to the damage total. This bonus rises to +2 if you are shapechanged into a beast (e.g. via {@spell polymorph} or {@classFeature wild shape|druid||2||wild shape}), or if you possess teeth or claws that act as weapons (such as the {@race tabaxi|vgm|tabaxi's} {@i Cat's Claws} feature or the effects of {@spell alter self}).

item.name: Amulet of the Warmage
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster
entries: Each facet of the affixed gems shimmer with a faint internal light, even in pitch darkness.

entries.name: Arcane Awareness
entries: While attuned to this amulet, you gain resistance to force damage and a +3 bonus to all Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks.

entries.name: Extra Tricks
entries: This amulet holds four charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to cast any cantrip from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}, whether you know it or not. Cantrips cast in this way scale with your character level, if applicable. This amulet regains {@dice 1d4} charges at the end of a long rest.

If the last charge of this amulet is expended, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, one of the gems cracks and the amulet permanently loses 1 charge. When all four charges are lost, the amulet crumbles to dust.

item.name: Angel's Sorrow
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, paladin, or ranger
entries: A perpetually-weeping angelic figure adorns the top of this sturdy metal staff.

entries.name: Divine Knowledge
entries: While attuned to this staff, you gain a +1 bonus to your Intelligence and Wisdom scores (to a maximum of 20).

entries.name: Tears of the Angel
entries: This staff holds 9 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 3} charges each day at dawn. If you are proficient in Intelligence ({@skill Religion}), all charges are regained at dawn instead.

entries.name: Heavenly Lament
entries: Whenever you cast a spell or use an ability that heals a target, they heal an additional number of hit points equal to the number of charges remaining in the staff.

entries.name: Celestial Flight
entries: You may expend 3 charges to cast {@spell fly} at 3rd level. You may cast this spell at a higher level by expending 2 additional charges per level.

entries.name: Call of the Heavens
entries: You may expend all 9 charges to cast {@spell harm} or {@spell heal} at 6th level. If this feature is used to cast {@i heal}, the target regains the additional 9 hit points granted by {@i Heavenly Lament}.

item.name: Armor of Atomlesztes
entries: Purple vestments adorn this fitted armor, with two skulls emblazoned on the chest in the form of a heart.

entries.name: Shield of the Afterlife
entries: If you drop to 0 hit points without being killed outright while attuned to this armor, you heal {@dice 3d10 + 5} hit points and do not fall {@condition unconscious}. All friendly creatures of your choice within 15 feet regain half the number of hit points you healed, and you deal the same amount of necrotic damage to all hostile creatures of your choice within 15 feet. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until seven days have passed.

entries.name: Step Into the Beyond
entries: Three times per long rest, you can use this armor to cast {@spell misty step}.

entries.name: Regalia of Mortality
entries: When you are attuned to this armor along with both {@i Gauntlets of Mortality} ({@item Gauntlet of Adni|RotR3} and {@item Gauntlet of Vesz|RotR3}), they count as a single attuned item instead of three separate items. The {@i Regalia of Mortality} are considered Legendary rarity.

In addition to the temporary hit points granted by the Gauntlets, while you are attuned to the Regalia you gain a +2 bonus to your AC and may use the {@i Lifegiver} and {@i Lifetaker} features of the Gauntlets twice each per long rest instead of once. Additionally, if you are affected by {@i Shield of the Afterlife}, it may affect you again after only three days have passed, rather than seven.

item.name: Axe of the Chromatic Queen
entries: The blade of this heavy {@item battleaxe|phb} is forged to to spring from the mouths of five tiny dragons of different colors.

entries.name: Forged in Dragonbreath
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Aspects of the Queen
entries: Once per turn on a successful hit this axe deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} extra damage. This damage may be one of the following types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

entries.name: Queen's Audience
entries: This axe may be used once per week to perform a ritual to cast {@spell gate}. The axe may be used in place of the listed material component (along with one of each of the following gemstones of any value, placed into each open maw of the dragons carved into the weapon: amethyst, diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire). When cast in this way, the spell has a casting time of 10 minutes instead of 1 action and can only be used to create a portal linking to the first circle of the Nine Hells. Additionally, the gemstones used as part of this ritual dissolve into ash and burn away once the portal closes.

item.name: Beauty Sleep Mask
entries: This luxurious padded sleep mask has one small gem embedded on the outside of each eye rest.

entries.name: Deep Sleep
entries: When you take a short or long rest wearing this mask, you recieve a −3 penalty to your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score and all active Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks are made with disadvantage. Additionally, wearing this mask {@condition blinded||blinds} you.

entries.name: Rested and Refreshed
entries: Following completion of a short rest while wearing this mask, you gain a +2 bonus to all Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made for the next hour. If you complete a long rest, this bonus persists for 16 hours.

item.name: Blade of the Corrupted Lotus
entries: The hilt of this heavy iron sword is orantely carved to resemble a blooming lotus.

entries.name: Dark Essence
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Lotus Bite
entries: The first time you hit with an attack on your turn, you may choose to drain the target of some of its life essence. You deal an additional {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to the target and gain the same amount of hit points. You can use this feature twice per long rest.

entries.name: Spark of Corruption
entries: This sword can hold up to 8 charges, and has 0 charges when you first attune to it. For every 2 charges stored in the sword, your Strength score increases by 1 (to a maximum of 22) as long as you are attuned to it.

Whenever you land the killing blow on a creature with this weapon, you may attempt to absorb some of its fleeting life essence. Make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10 + the number of charges currently stored in the sword). On a success, the sword gains 1 charge. On a failure, you take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage for each charge currently stored in the sword. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
At the end of each long rest, this sword loses {@dice 2d4} charges (to a minimum of 0). For every 2 charges lost, your Strength score is reduced by 1.

item.name: Collar of the Chromatic Queen
entries: This dragonskin collar features five semiprecious gems embedded around its length.

entries.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: At the end of a long rest while wearing this collar, roll a {@dice d6} and consult the table below. You gain the listed benefit until the end of your next long rest. If the collar is removed or destroyed, you lose this benefit prematurely.

rows: +1 bonus to AC and resistance of your choice from above

item.name: Coin of Draconic Luck
entries: This seemingly nondescript coin has two draconic faces emblazoned on either side, which shimmer with a different color upon landing One face shines with a metallic sheen, and the other is a dull flat color.

entries.name: Dragon's Bargain
entries: Before making an ability check or attack roll, you may choose to {@chance 50|flip a coin}. On heads, the coin lands metallic side up and the following roll is made with advantage. On tails, the coin lands chromatic side up and the following roll is made with disadvantage. This feature may be used three times per day.
If the coin lands on tails three times in a row, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1 the coin cracks in two and loses all magical properties.

item.name: Downfall
entries: This weapon exudes an aura of malice, making anyone who looks directly at it uncomfortable for reasons they can't explain.

entries.name: Infernal Steel
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行攻击和伤害的时候有一个+1的奖励。

entries.name: Brought Back
entries: While attuned to this weapon, if you are at 0 hit points and fail a death saving throw you are instead healed for an amount equal to half of your maximum hit points and return to consciousness.
This effect can only happen once to you. Unattuning and reattuning to this weapon does not allow you to gain the benefit of this feature again.

item.name: Downfall (Cursed)
entries: This weapon exudes an aura of malice, making anyone who looks directly at it uncomfortable for reasons they can't explain.

entries.name: Infernal Steel
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行攻击和伤害的时候有一个+1的奖励。

entries.name: Brought Back
entries: While attuned to this weapon, if you are at 0 hit points and fail a death saving throw you are instead healed for an amount equal to half of your maximum hit points and return to consciousness.
This effect can only happen once to you. Unattuning and reattuning to this weapon does not allow you to gain the benefit of this feature again.

entries.name: Infernal Pact (Curse)
entries: 这把武器被诅咒了，成为它的附属品会使诅咒延伸到你身上。在用{@spell remove curse}或类似的魔法解除诅咒之前，你不愿意与这把武器分离，一直保持它在手边。

If you gain the benefit of {@i Brought Back} above, you now owe your life to an infernal creature or entity. How and when this debt is paid will be determined by your DM. Unattuning from this weapon does not resolve this debt.

item.name: Zephyr's Edge
entries: This finely-crafted {@item rapier|phb} hums with electricity as it passes through the air.

entries.name: Stormforged
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This weapon also deals an additional 2 lightning damage with each hit.

entries.name: Last Act
entries: Whenever you land the killing blow on a creature with this weapon, the last of the creature's life essence is channeled through the blade into a burst of electricity. Each creature in a 15-foot line directly away from you (toward the target) must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6 + 2} lightning damage, taking half damage on a success.

entries.name: Lightning Rod
entries: As an action, you may raise the rapier into the air and call down a bolt of lighting on a creature or object you can see within 100 feet. A creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6 + 2} lightning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. On a success, the target takes half the lighting damage and is not stunned. You may use this feature once per long rest.

item.name: Efreeti's Kusarigama
entries: This curiously-shaped {@item sickle|phb} has a long chain attached to the rear end of its handle.

entries.name: Solid Flame Blade
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This weapon also deals an additional 2 fire damage with each hit.

entries.name: Grip of the Fire Genie
entries: You can use this weapon's chain and counterbalance to attempt to {@action grapple} a creature. Your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check made to grapple is made with advantage if the creature is more than 5 feet away. Upon a successful grapple, the target receives {@damage 1d6} fire damage, taking another {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the end of each of its turns if it is still grappled.

item.name: Elderam's Gift
entries: This {@item dagger|phb} appears to be little more than a shard of some form of green crystal wrapped with twine.

entries.name: Plane-wrought
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Emerald Menace
entries: As an action, you may drive this dagger into the ground and speak a command word, causing 2-foot-tall crystal spikes to erupt from the ground in a 15-foot cone. Any creature within the cone must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} piercing damage, taking half damage on a success.

The crystals persist, causing the area to become rough terrain. The first time a creature moves into or within the they must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage per 5 feet moved.

The crystals may be shattered by attacking them. The crystals have an AC of 8 and 3 hit points per 5-foot square covered. Otherwise, the crystals instantly retract when this dagger is pulled from the ground.
This feature may be used twice per long rest.

item.name: Elianim, The Dawnspark
item.reqAttune: by a cleric or paladin
entries: This ancient {@item warhammer|phb}, forged in the storms of the waning years of the Dawn War, was granted to the paladins of {@deity Pelor|dawn war|dmg} by {@deity Kord|dawn war|dmg} to aid in their fight against {@deity Tharizdun|dawn war|dmg}. Very few were bestowed, and even fewer still survive to the present day.
You have a +4 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Fury of the Storm
entries: Elianim deals an extra {@damage 1d4} lightning and {@damage 1d4} thunder damage on hit.

entries.name: Heart of the Sun
entries: While attuned to this weapon, your Constitution score increases by 2.

entries.name: Aura of the Dawn
entries: This weapon sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. This light may be suppressed at will (no action required). This light is sunlight.
While this light is visible, you and all allies within 20 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against becoming {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Mercy of the Rain
entries: This hammer holds 3 charges of crystallized light within the head. Whenever you cast a healing spell, you can expend one charge to heal one target for an extra {@dice 2d6} hit points. All three charges are restored at dawn.

item.name: Fang of the Gatekeeper
entries: This {@item dagger|phb} seems to endlessly seep blood from the hilt, though the fluid never drips from the blade.

entries.name: Bite of the Hound
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The additional damage is necrotic.

entries.name: Guardian of the Afterlife
entries: This weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to humanoid or undead creatures.

entries.name: Master's Command
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check while attuned to this dagger, you may add an additional {@dice 1d6} to the roll. In addition, depending on the roll, one of the following effects manifests for a few moments.

rows: Your voice deepens and resonates loudly
All light within 10 feet of you darkens

item.name: Gauntlet of Adni
entries: Touching anything with this soft purple glove feels like it isn't even there—you can feel everything perfectly well.

entries.name: Touch of Life
entries: When you deal damage with an unarmed strike, that damage is dealt as radiant damage instead of bludgeoning.

entries.name: Protector of the Living
entries: You can use this glove to cast {@spell spare the dying} at will.

entries.name: Lifegiver
entries: As an action, you can point to a creature you can see within 90 feet. You suffer {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and the target heals a number of hit points equal the damage you took. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Gauntlets of Mortality
entries: When you are attuned to both the Gauntlet of Adni and the {@item Gauntlet of Vesz|RotR3}, they count as a set and take only one attunement slot. The {@i Gauntlets of Mortality} are considered Very Rare.
Additionally, at the end of each long rest you gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your character level.

item.name: Gauntlet of Vesz
entries: Upon donning this firm purple gauntlet, nearly all sensation is shut out on that hand.

entries.name: Touch of Death
entries: When you deal damage with an unarmed strike, that damage is dealt as necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning.

entries.name: Death Caller
entries: You can use this glove to cast {@spell true strike} at will.

entries.name: Lifetaker
entries: As an action, you can point to a creature you can see within 90 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffer {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. You heal a number of hit points equal the damage inflicted. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Gauntlets of Mortality
entries: When you are attuned to both the {@item Gauntlet of Adni|RotR3} and the Gauntlet of Vesz, they count as a set and take only one attunement slot. The {@i Gauntlets of Mortality} are considered Very Rare.
Additionally, at the end of each long rest you gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your character level.

item.name: Gloves of the Verdant Sentry
item.reqAttune: by a monk
entries: These green gloves each have one half of a shield emblem emblazoned on the back.

entries.name: Reinforced Strikes
entries: While attuned to these gloves, you gain a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls made for your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Clasp of Protection
entries: You can snap the half-shields on these gloves together as a reaction, summoning an invisible barrier around you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +2 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from {@spell magic missile}.
You can use this ability three times per long rest.

entries.name: Broken Seal
entries: When you attack after using the {@i Clasp of Protection} feature, your first unarmed strike with each hand deals an extra {@damage 1d4} force damage.

item.name: Greataxe of the Hills
entries: This heavy greataxe features a curiously extended handle, with reinforcements along the body.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Over-axe-tended
entries: Before making an attack roll with this weapon, you can choose to take a −3 penalty to the attack roll to gain the {@i Reach} property.

item.name: Halberd of the Northern Tribe
entries: The handle of this halberd feels cool to the touch, even in warm environments.

entries.name: Northern Smithing
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行攻击和伤害的时候有一个+1的奖励。

entries.name: Frost Guardian
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you have resistance to cold damage and do not suffer any impairments (or gain levels of {@condition exhaustion}) from cold weather conditions.

entries.name: Frostbite
entries: On a successful hit from this weapon, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d4} cold damage.

item.name: Hood of the Dragon Turtle
entries: Made to resemble {@creature dragon turtle||its namesake} and crafted from the scales and hide of the same, the gems embedded in each eye socket glow slightly when near a body of water.

entries.name: Fortitude of the Deep
entries: While you are attuned to this hood, you gain a +4 bonus to your Constitution score, to a maximum of 22.

entries.name: Dark Ocean Ancestry
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet while attuned to this hood. In addition, you are able to breathe both water and air.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: As an action, you can exhale steam in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} fire damage, taking half damage on a success. This damage increases to {@damage 3d8} at 6th level, {@damage 4d8} at 11th level, and {@damage 5d8} at 16th level. Being underwater does not provide any protection from this feature.
Once this feature has been used, it cannot be used again until the end of your next short or long rest.

itemGroup.name: Runechalk
entries: This simple piece of chalk has been imbued with arcane power that can be released by drawing different shapes on surfaces.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the adraloth's darkvision.

trait.name: Many Eyes
entries: The adraloth can see in all directions at once and has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: The adraloth can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adraloth makes three attacks with its blades.

action.name: Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eyes of the Abyss
